ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: No prep work was needed for this class.
1 hour
Whatever the scheduled amount of time is for the course that week.
Only during seminar - 2 hours max
i exempted out of this course

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Good
It was great to have extremely interesting speakers on a wide range of topics.
Strong seminar. High level of speakers.

This was an excellent seminar series and often my favorite class of the week. Having successful individuals come to speak about their career trajectory and their thoughts on the current healthcare system was inspiring and incredibly motivational. Often, I found myself remembering why I wanted to pursue a MPH in the first place.
Hands down the best use of my time here so far.
Strengths: Excellent speakers
It's a good course to socialize and network. The only negative part is that it is on Thursday nights and a lot of SOM activities fall on that time slot. I would just like a better time than that.
Great for HCM.
fun to hear people talk about their career paths and current responsibilities

One way to help integrate the HCM students into SOM would be to try to change the timing of this seminar so that it does not conflict with closing bell or SOM recruiting events. I'm not sure if there are any other times that would be feasible given the speaker's schedules, but just a thought. It might be nice to have some hands-on workshop style sessions.
I enjoy hearing the experiences and stories of all of the speakers! They always have interesting viewpoints.
Very inspiring speaker series to serve as an introduction for first-year students to learn about health care administration from different aspects. Astounding speakers.
This course is fantastic and the quality of speakers that Howie invites is great.
Very interesting to hear perspectives of different healthcare leaders in both the private and public sector. Extremely enlightening and valuable.
Good!
lovely way to learn more about people and how they got to where they are now.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great!!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Not applicable.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Excellent guide through discussions and very open to student feedback and opinions
Instructor: Howard P Forman  He is a great professor and adviser. My only concern is that I feel like he has too much on his plate and may not have enough time to individually help his students.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Dr. Forman is great for organizing this.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great mix of speakers!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is Da Best
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is very flexible, and I am glad he brings in such great speakers.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is great!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great instructor
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Very caring of students' opinions and try to integrate those into their experiences as much as he can. Very direct in his opinions and it's helpful!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Good!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  He always gave us a good introduction of speakers
Instructor: Howard P Forman  it would be nice if he could include more female lecturers

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good
Interesting curse. I would definitely recommend it.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student because it presents a broader view on what we can accomplish with our MPH.
highly recommended
It's a great way to learn about important topics in healthcare and, perhaps more interestingly, learn how experts in the field came to do what they're doing.
It's ok. Depending on the week, you can a great interesting person or not.
Yes
good exposure and opportunities
Great class to learn about different perspectives in healthcare
Why wouldn't you take it!?
Yes, great chance to hear amazing speakers and ask them questions
Well worth the time investment, even if not taking the course for credit. The quality of the speakers is unparalleled in any other seminar.
Recommend it
